priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Immunogenicity Specimen Assessments Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120525

self.title: CDISC SDTM Immunogenicity Specimen Assessments Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the immunogenicity specimen test codes of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model.
name: Immunogenicity Specimen Assessments Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Immunogenicity Specimen Assessments Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the antibody-secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Antibody-secreting Cells Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug antibody in a biological specimen. A binding antidrug antibody is an antibody that binds to a test article, and/or portion(s) of the test article.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the neutralizing binding antidrug antibody in a biological specimen. A neutralizing binding antidrug antibody is a type of ADA that binds to the functional portion of a test article leading to diminished or negated pharmacological activity.
terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Binding Antidrug Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the neutralizing cross-reactive binding antidrug antibody in a biological specimen. A neutralizing cross-reactive binding antidrug antibody is a type of ADA that binds to an endogenous molecule that is structurally similar to an analogue test article and diminishes or negates its function.
terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Cross-Reacting Binding Antidrug Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the cross-reactive binding antidrug antibody in a biological specimen. A cross-reactive binding antidrug antibody is a type of ADA that binds to the endogenous molecule that is structurally similar to an analogue test article.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug IgA antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgA Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug IgE antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgE Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug IgG antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgG Antibody Measurement

terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgG4 Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug IgG and/or IgM antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgG/IgM Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding antidrug IgM antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Binding Antidrug IgM Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the cross-reactive binding antidrug IgA antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgA Antibody Measurement

terms.preferredTerm: Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgE Antibody Measurement

terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Binding Antidrug IgM Antibody Measurement

synonyms: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgG Antibody

terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug Antibody IgG1 Measurement

terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug Antibody IgG4 Measurement
synonyms: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgG4 Antibody

terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug Antibody IgG/IgM Measurement
synonyms: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgG/IgM Antibody

terms.definition: A measurement of the neutralizing cross-reactive binding antidrug IgM antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug Antibody IgM Measurement
synonyms: Neutralizing Cross-Reactive Binding Antidrug IgM Antibody

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding allergen-induced IgE antibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Allergen-induced IgE Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding autoantibody in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Autoantibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the cytokine-secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Cytokine-secreting Cells Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the Ebola virus specific IgG antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Ebola Virus Specific IgG Antibody Secreting Cell Count
synonyms: EBOV Specific IgG AB Secreting Cells

terms.definition: A measurement of the Ebola virus specific IgM antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Ebola Virus Specific IgM Antibody Secreting Cell Count
synonyms: EBOV Specific IgM AB Secreting Cells

terms.definition: A measurement of the H1 specific IgG antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Influenza Hemagglutinin 1 Specific IgG Antibody Secreting Cell Count
synonyms: H1 Specific IgG Antibody Secreting Cells

terms.definition: A measurement of the H3 specific IgG antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Influenza Hemagglutinin 3 Specific IgG Antibody Secreting Cell Count
synonyms: H3 Specific IgG Antibody Secreting Cells

terms.definition: A measurement of the HIV-1 seroreactivity in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: HIV-1 Seroreactivity Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the HIV-2 seroreactivity in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: HIV-2 Seroreactivity Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the total IgM antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: IgM Antibody Secreting Cell Count

terms.definition: A measurement of the functional binding microbial-induced antibody in a biological specimen. A functional microbial-induced antibody is defined as antibodies that have agonist or antagonist effects on pathogens or their toxins in the presence of other effector molecules or cells. For example, the effects of functional antibodies can include neutralization, phagocytosis, antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity, and complement-mediated lysis. The production of this antibody may be triggered by naturally occurring infection and/or vaccination using a whole microbe or component(s) of a microbe.
terms.preferredTerm: Functional Microbial-induced Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the binding microbial-induced IgG antibody in a biological specimen; the production of this antibody may be triggered by naturally occurring infection and/or vaccination using a whole microbe or component(s) of a microbe.
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial-induced IgG Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the neutralizing binding microbial-induced antibody in a biological specimen. A neutralizing microbial-induced antibody is a type of functional antibody that's defined as antibodies that bind to, block and prevent microbes from infecting cells. The production of this antibody may be triggered by naturally occurring infection and/or vaccination using a whole microbe or component(s) of a microbe.
terms.preferredTerm: Neutralizing Microbial-induced Antibody Measurement

terms.definition: A measurement of the total IgG antibody secreting cells in a biological specimen.
terms.preferredTerm: Total IgG Antibody Secreting Cell Count

terms.definition: A relative measurement (ratio or percentage) of T-lymphocyte proliferation due to stimulation by an antigen of interest to a non-stimulated T-lymphocyte proliferation control.
terms.preferredTerm: T-Lymphocyte Proliferation Index
